intro: Humiria multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered humiria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical forests. Humiria multiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
